00021     Observation& Observation::operator=(Observation& rhs) {
00022         if (&rhs != this) {
00023             features = rhs.getFeatures();
00024             eligible = rhs.getEligible();
00025             agent = rhs.getAgent();
00026             steps = rhs.getSteps();
00027         }
00028         return *this;
00029     }
00030 
00031 
00032     void Observation::init(int rows, int cols, int agents, int actions) {
00033 
00034         // Arbitrary matrix
00035         features.resize(rows, cols);
00036         
00037         // In the single agent case the eligible vector says which actions
00038         // are eligible. In the multi-agent case it says which agents are
00039         // eligible.
00040         eligible.resize((agents==1)?actions:agents);
00041         eligible.clear();
00042   
00043         // This is initialised to all ones so that the default behaviour is
00044         // to run all agents. This means that if you don't know anything
00045         // about the eligible vector you should still get the expected
00046         // behaviour. I.e., you have to manually turn off agents, not
00047         // manually turn them on!
00048         for (bVector::iterator i = eligible.begin(); i != eligible.end(); i++) *i=true;
00049 
00050         agent=0; // Default to first obs, always. Might not be used.
00051 
00052         steps=0;
00053 
00054     }
00055 }
